title: Miami dominance and a UCLA stunner: Recapping a chaotic Week 6
content: In Week 6, the Grim Reaper came for Penn State and Texas, but Miami proved itself against Florida State.

title: Ex-QB Sanchez arrested, faces 3 possible charges
content: Former NFL quarterback and current Fox Sports broadcaster Mark Sanchez was arrested in Indianapolis on Saturday and is facing three misdemeanor charges in relation to an incident where he was stabbed and taken to a hospital.

title: With Skubal up next, Tigers notch 'huge' G1 win
content: After winning two of three in Cleveland during the wild-card round, the Detroit Tigers, who have spent the past two weeks on the road, took a 1-0 lead in the best-of-five American League Division Series on Saturday via a 3-2 win over the Seattle Mariners.

title: Pereira reclaims title in 80-second TKO of Ankalaev
content: Alex Pereira is the champion of the light heavyweights again after crushing Magomed Ankalaev in 80 seconds of Round 1 on Saturday at UFC 320.

title: Another Hernandez HR lifts Dodgers over Phillies
content: Teoscar Hernandez rallied the Los Angeles Dodgers with a three-run homer in the seventh inning that silenced the crowd and led his club to a 5-3 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies in Game 1 of their National League Division Series on Saturday night.

title: 'Embarrassing' loss at UCLA has Penn St. reeling
content: A week removed from its first loss of the season, a home defeat to Oregon, No. 7 Penn State dropped a 42-37 decision to previously winless UCLA at the Rose Bowl on Saturday, as the Bruins became the first 0-4 team to defeat a top-10 team since 1985.

title: Miami defends 'state champs' label, defeats FSU
content: With eyes now on an ACC championship and their first run in the College Football Playoff, No. 3 Miami wrapped up its version of the "state title" on Saturday night, defeating No. 18 Florida State 28-22, after earlier dispatching Florida and South Florida.

title: Vlad Jr.'s playoff breakout fuels Jays past Yanks
content: Vladimir Guerrero Jr.'s first-inning homer was part of a three-hit night that gave the Blue Jays a "jolt" in Saturday's 10-1 Game 1 win over the Yankees.

title: Sources: Collier cancels meeting with Engelbert
content: Minnesota Lynx forward Napheesa Collier has canceled her meeting with WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert next week, sources told ESPN.

title: üòÜ Top trolls from college football Week 6
content: UCLA delivered a statement upset of Penn State on Saturday, and then brought the troll game to back it up afterward.

title: Cramming for NFL Week 5: Five fantasy sleepers, three predictions, three trends and an intriguing bet
content: Will the Giants' receivers step up? More success coming for Woody Marks? A lot of points expected in Raiders-Colts? Here's last-minute intel for Week 5.

title: Dramatic Chelsea win makes a statement and raises a question: Are Liverpool in crisis?
content: While Chelsea coach Enzo Maresca got a big statement win, worries for Liverpool and Mohamed Salah deepen.

title: Russell takes surprise Singapore pole over Verstappen
content: George Russell took a surprise pole position for Mercedes at the Singapore Grand Prix ahead of Red Bull's Max Verstappen in second place and championship leader Oscar Piastri in third.

title: How did the Browns decide on starting QB No. 41? Inside their 'intentional' methods
content: The quarterbacks room has been developed to give Dillon Gabriel (named Sunday's starter) and Shedeur Sanders space to grow.

title: Marner in Vegas, Sullivan in New York and Crosby ... on the move? Guide to the NHL season
content: Miss anything the past few months? Miss everything? Get caught up here before opening night on Tuesday.

title: Wetzel: Collier comments reflect WNBA's core problem: How it sees Caitlin Clark
content: In seeming to not embrace the player who singlehandedly lifted the WNBA, the league risks losing her fan base.

title: College football recruiting intel: Could we see big flips? Which classes could rise?
content: Are Florida recruits wavering? Could we see some five-star flips? We look at where the classes and top prospects stand.

title: Paolo Banchero, Trae Young: Breaking down 10 names that could define NBA season
content: ESPN's Tim Bontemps breaks down players and personnel that will play major roles on the court and beyond.

title: Eric Karabell's 'Do not draft' list, including LaMelo Ball, Ja Morant, Joel Embiid
content: Eric Karabell highlights the players to fade at their current average draft position in fantasy basketball drafts.

title: Draft guide: All you need to win your league this season
content: We've got everything you need to help you prepare for and execute a successful draft, all in one place.

title: Last-minute pickups for Week 5: Jaxson Dart, Brenton Strange among top options
content: With many quality fantasy starters on byes this week, we have options at each position to fill in for you.

title: 'Two Hall of Fame quarterbacks just battling it out': A mini-oral history of 2015 Superdome Duel
content: With the Saints hosting the Giants on Sunday, we asked those who were there to recall the teams' epic 52-49 game.

title: Kelly scores stunner but Arsenal lose at Man City. Are Gunners' title hopes over already?
content: Arsenal's Chloe Kelly scored against former club Manchester City, but the Gunners fell to a defeat that puts a big early dent in their WSL title hopes.

title: Projecting 2026 No. 9 Jacy Abii's fit at Notre Dame, more five-star commits
content: Breaking down the fits of every five-star commitment, including the third Fighting Irish recruit for 2026-27.

title: Christian Horner's F1 return: Where next after Red Bull exit?
content: With Christian Horner now free to return to Formula 1 in 2026, speculation about his next landing spot is rife - ESPN ranks the likelihood of his options.

title: üìà Ranking all 68 Power 4 QBs: A surprise No. 1
content: What have we learned about the signal-callers so far? Here's where Arch Manning, Beau Pribula and others stand.

title: ü©∫ Tyreek Hill injury timeline, impact on Fins
content: What is the Dolphins WR's outlook for a dislocated knee, the on-field impact of his absence and his future in Miami.

title: üëä MMA stars rank Hollywood actors as fighters
content: ESPN assembled a panel of MMA experts to determine which Hollywood stars would win a UFC-style event.

title: üèÜ Barnwell's NFL quarter-season awards
content: Can Josh Allen win another MVP? Could anyone edge Myles Garrett for DPOY? We ranked the top three candidates to win seven NFL awards through four weeks.

title: ‚õ≥ Ryder envelope rule must change, Bradley says
content: U.S. captain Keegan Bradley said the Ryder Cup's longstanding envelope rule involving injured players should change, but European counterpart Luke Donald said it's there to protect players and should remain in place.

title: üó£Ô∏è Players support Collier in ripping WNBA
content: Players across the WNBA supported Napheesa Collier after she ripped WNBA leadership in her exit interview Tuesday.

title: üí∞ Sources: Big Ten mulling $2B capital deal
content: The Big Ten is in talks about a private capital deal, which includes a 10-year grant of rights extension through 2046, that would infuse at least $2 billion into the league and its schools, sources told ESPN.

title: üèà Colts CB Howard abruptly retires
content: Veteran cornerback Xavien Howard, 32, informed the Colts of his decision to retire just days after his much-criticized performance against the Rams.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid keen on Man City's Rodri
content: Manchester City and Spain international midfielder Rodri is a target for Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Darjeeling landslides: Toll rises to 18; Mamata to visit affected areas tomorrow
content: Torrential rains have unleashed devastating landslides across Darjeeling and Kalimpong hills, claiming at least nine lives and leaving several missing. Vital roads are cut off, and bridges damaged, severely disrupting daily life. Rescue operations are underway amidst challenging conditions.

title: Elon Musk's SpaceX wins contracts worth $714 million from Pentagon
content: The US Space Force awarded SpaceX five of seven critical military launch contracts totaling $714 million, reinforcing its dominance in Pentagon space missions. United Launch Alliance secured the remaining two missions for $428 million. Blue Origin's New Glenn rocket remains uncertified for these National Security Space Launch missions, missing out on this cycle's awards.

title: Flash floods alert in Bengal: Bhutan's Tala dam overflows; NDRF on 'highest alert'
content: North Bengal is on high alert as Bhutan's Tala hydropower dam overflows due to a gate malfunction, raising fears of downstream flooding in West Bengal's Dooars. This situation compounds deadly landslides in Darjeeling, which killed at least seven people, prompting NDRF deployment and Prime Minister Modi's assurance of central assistance amidst ongoing heavy rainfall forecasts.

title: Karur stampede: Police books TVK chief Vijay's campaign vehicle driver; SIT begins probe
content: Tamil Nadu Police registered a case against actor-politician Vijay‚Äôs campaign vehicle driver and his party, TVK, after an accident involving fans. The Madras High Court strongly criticised authorities for inaction, ordering a hit-and-run case against Vijay himself, condemning his party's irresponsibility for fleeing two collision scenes. A Special Investigation Team has also begun probing the Karur stampede tragedy.

title: Tehran cuts ties with IAEA after 'snapback sanctions'; ends Cairo Agreement
content: Iran announced it ended cooperation with the UN nuclear watchdog, IAEA, citing reimposed ‚Äúsnapback‚Äù sanctions and recent military tensions. Foreign Minister Araghchi declared the Cairo Agreement invalid, criticising Western pressure tactics. This decision follows a June war where Israel, then the US, attacked Iranian nuclear sites, leading to Iran's retaliation and a ceasefire.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang on why he supports Trump's $100,000 H-1B Visa fee
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang supports President Trump's new $100,000 H-1B visa fee for fresh applications, calling it a "great start" to reshape immigration policy and attract the "brightest minds." He acknowledges the high cost but believes it sets a meaningful threshold. Critics, however, warn the move could lead to brain drain and undermine America's tech leadership.

title: 'Ready to stay in jail': Sonam Wangchuk demands judicial probe in Ladakh protest deaths
content: Ladakh activist Sonam Wangchuk, currently held in Jodhpur Central Jail, has called for peace and unity among Ladakhis. He demands an independent judicial inquiry into the killing of four protestors during recent violent unrest in Leh, which erupted over statehood and Sixth Schedule demands. Wangchuk, detained under NSA, advocates for a peaceful, non-violent struggle.

title: Handshake drama continues! Harmanpreet Kaur ignores Pak captain at toss at Women's World Cup
content: The India-Pakistan Women‚Äôs World Cup match in Colombo commenced with palpable tension as captains Harmanpreet Kaur and Fatima Sana skipped the traditional handshake. This gesture mirrored heightened political and sporting unease, with BCCI officials confirming a non-committal stance on sportsmanship, aligning with the men‚Äôs team. India, confident after a prior win, face a struggling Pakistan side.

title: Watch: Rowdy celebrates birthday behind bars in B'luru; cake cutting video goes viral
content: A viral video shows undertrial prisoner Gubbachhi Seena celebrating his birthday with cake and a large knife inside Bengaluru's Central Prison, prompting an ADGP inquiry. The celebration, recorded on a mobile phone, occurred months ago. Seena, accused of murder, had his rival's wife expose the clip. Police are now investigating mobile phone entry and facilitation of the event.

title: Billionaire Lucy Guo on family pushback; parents saw her choices as ‚Äònot loving them‚Äô
content: Lucy Guo, 30, has joined the billionaire ranks with a $1.25 billion fortune, following her company Scale AI's $29 billion acquisition by Meta. The college dropout defied her immigrant parents' wishes by leaving Carnegie Mellon, opting instead for the Thiel Fellowship. Now leading Passes, Guo's journey underscores prioritizing real-world experience, though she acknowledges college's unique networking benefits for aspiring entrepreneurs.

title: It‚Äôs a girl! Arbaaz and Sshura Khan welcome their first child
content: Bollywood actor Arbaaz Khan and his wife, makeup artist Sshura Khan, have welcomed a baby girl, bringing immense joy to the entire Khan family. The couple, who married in December 2023, celebrated the new arrival with Salman and Sohail Khan. Sshura was hospitalized in Mumbai before the birth, with Arbaaz previously expressing excitement about embracing fatherhood again.

title: Bad Bunny mocks conservative news network on latest SNL episode
content: Bad Bunny, the Latino rapper and LGBTQ+ ally, is reportedly being considered to headline the 2026 Super Bowl halftime show. He recently joked on SNL that even Fox News, which was previously furious about his potential involvement, is now happy about the prospect. This highlights a surprising shift in perception.

title: Nepal hit by Monsoon: At least 42 dead in landslides, flood
content: At least 18 people died in landslides and flooding in Ilam, Eastern Nepal, over the past 24 hours, with authorities expecting the death toll to rise. Security forces are evacuating residents in Kathmandu Valley as rivers swell. Several districts face high risk, and nearly two million people could be affected by the unexpected, renewed monsoon downpours.

title: ‚ÄòLives could've been saved‚Äô: Arrested doc suspended in cough syrup case
content: A paediatrician in Madhya Pradesh was suspended and arrested after 11 children died from kidney failure linked to contaminated Coldrif syrup he prescribed. The syrup contained toxic diethylene glycol, leading to an ongoing investigation into the full chain of responsibility. Authorities have banned the syrup, initiated multi-state inspections, and announced compensation for affected families.

title: 'End of an era': Rohit‚Äôs old post goes viral as Gill replaces him as ODI captain
content: Shubman Gill has been appointed India's new ODI captain, replacing Rohit Sharma, and will also lead in Tests. This leadership change streamlines captaincy across formats, with Rohit retained as a specialist batter. Significant squad changes include dropping key bowlers and appointing Shreyas Iyer as ODI vice-captain, marking a major transition in Indian cricket.

title: 'Dragged by hair, paraded in Israeli flag': Eyewitnesses detail Greta's detention
content: Eyewitnesses on a Gaza aid flotilla reported Greta Thunberg was dragged, beaten, and paraded by Israeli forces after her detention. A Swedish official's email corroborated mistreatment, including bedbugs and insufficient food. Other detainees also faced abuse, with an Israeli minister calling them "terrorists," marking Thunberg's second such arrest.

title: New toll rules: Get FASTag now or pay extra! Cash users to pay double ‚Äì check details
content: From November 15, 2025, National Highway toll plazas will implement new rules to boost digital payments. Vehicles without a valid FASTag will pay double the fee in cash or 1.25 times via UPI. This move aims to enhance efficiency, reduce congestion, and improve the user experience on highways.

title: 'Why is he even in the team?' ‚Äì Ex-India captain lambasts Harshit selection
content: Former India selector Krishnamachari Srikkanth slammed Harshit Rana's ODI squad inclusion for the Australia tour, questioning constant reshuffles and Sanju Samson's omission. Srikkanth criticized Rana's rapid rise, unimpressive Asia Cup showing, and "filmy gimmicks," suggesting such selections jeopardize India's 2027 World Cup ambitions and dent player confidence.

title: Justin fields injury update: Will he play vs. Dallas Cowboys today?
content: Justin Fields is officially active and fully healthy for the New York Jets' Week 5 showdown against the Dallas Cowboys. Cleared from concussion protocols, Fields is set to lead the offense, building on his impressive 2025 season stats. His dual-threat capabilities and leadership are central to the Jets' game plan, making him the focal point for today's crucial matchup.

title: Zubeen Garg death mystery continues: Assam CM questions bandmate's 'poisoning' claim
content: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma questioned the "poisoning" claims in Zubeen Garg's mysterious death, urging patience for the viscera report and cooperation from Singapore witnesses. He highlighted that the allegation came from an accused, not authorities. A judicial commission has been formed, and four individuals, including the alleged poisoners and the accuser, have been arrested in the ongoing probe.

title: Watch: Shikhar Dhawan visits Shri Mahakaleshwar Temple, joins Bhasma Aarti ritual
content: Shikhar Dhawan visited the Shri Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga Temple in Ujjain. He attended the Bhasma Aarti ritual. Videos captured his temple visit. India batter Abhishek Sharma revealed Dhawan's guidance. Dhawan taught him manifestation techniques for cricket success. Sharma used these methods before a game. He wrote a chit and scored a hundred.

title: Harvard trained gastroenterologist reveals 10 best foods for gas and bloating
content: Bloating occurs when excess air or gas buildup gets trapped in the digestive tract or when gut muscles fail to move food efficiently. This can be triggered by eating too fast and swallowing air, consuming gas-producing foods or food intolerances. The good news is that certain foods can actively soothe the digestive system by providing enzymes that break down food efficiently.

title: Studying in New York: An Indian student‚Äôs ground reality; step beyond comfort now
content: An Indian student at Parsons School of Design in New York shares the realities of studying abroad, navigating a new city, adapting to project-based learning, and embracing opportunities beyond the classroom. From overcoming homesickness to showcasing work in Times Square, his journey highlights resilience, creativity, and growth. His advice: step outside your comfort zone for true learning.

title: Bitcoin reaches all-time high! Largest crypto surpasses $125,000 mark
content: Bitcoin surged to a new all-time high of $125,689, propelled by safe-haven demand amidst the US government shutdown and investor bets on dollar debasement. Corporate adoption and traditional October strength also fueled this record rise, with experts highlighting Bitcoin's distinct response to current economic uncertainties.

title: Gurgaon horror: Invited by friend for party, teacher gang-raped by 4 men; all arrested
content: A 29-year-old foreign languages teacher in Gurgaon has accused four gym trainers of sexual assault and gang rape. The victim met one suspect, Gaurav, at a party, later agreeing to meet him on October 1. At a friend's address, Gaurav allegedly assaulted her, then called three others who also raped her. Police arrested all four suspects, now in judicial custody.

title: 'So sad!': Divya Deshmukh reacts to hilarious typo on her jersey - Watch
content: Women's World Cup winner Divya Deshmukh lightened the mood with a jersey typo during the 'Checkmate: USA vs India' exhibition. However, Team India suffered a 5-0 defeat to Team USA, highlighted by Hikaru Nakamura's dramatic bullet win over Gukesh Dommaraju. A return leg in India offers Team India a chance for redemption.

title: 'Pakistan my Janmabhoomi, but India is my Matrubhumi': Ex-Pak cricketer
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Danish Kaneria denied seeking Indian citizenship, stating he lives in the USA with his family. He expressed pride in his Pakistani identity despite facing discrimination and conversion pressure, clarifying his positive comments about India are not for citizenship. Kaneria, who calls India his ancestral land, also mentioned the CAA and his commitment to exposing anti-nationals.

title: Wall Street rallying despite gov shutdown concerns, here is what to look for
content: Defying a US government shutdown, the stock market surged to record highs, with broad gains across indices and assets. While AI optimism and anticipated Fed rate cuts fuel the rally, experts caution about expensive valuations nearing dot-com bubble levels. Future performance hinges on corporate earnings and AI's ability to boost productivity.

title: Doctor held after 11 kids die in MP from toxic Coldrif; TN manufacturers booked
content: A doctor in Chhindwara, Madhya Pradesh, has been arrested after 11 children reportedly died from consuming contaminated Coldrif cough syrup. Dr. Praveen Soni prescribed the syrup, with most children treated at his clinic. Police have also booked the Tamil Nadu-based pharmaceutical company responsible for manufacturing the alleged contaminated medicine.

title: All eyes on Gaza: Netanyahu positive on Hamas deal, Trump wary of any 'delay'
content: Hamas's readiness to release hostages under US President Donald Trump‚Äôs ceasefire plan has sparked guarded optimism from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who vows to disarm the group. Mediated talks are set for Egypt, aiming for a deal involving hostage-prisoner exchanges and Israeli withdrawal. Despite hopes for peace, violence persists in Gaza, and questions remain about the plan's full implementation.

title: Scientists turn human skin cells into eggs in groundbreaking fertility breakthrough
content: US researchers successfully created early-stage human embryos from adult skin cells, bypassing traditional egg cells through advanced DNA manipulation. This groundbreaking OHSU study, mirroring cloning techniques, generated functional eggs that developed into early embryos. The innovation offers significant hope for infertility and same-sex couples, despite current low success rates and ethical considerations requiring further refinement.

title: 'Did unimaginable things': Greta accuses Israel of harsh treatment in custody ‚Äî What she said
content: Greta Thunberg reported harsh treatment, dehydration, and bedbug-induced rashes in Israeli custody after her detention from a Gaza aid flotilla. Other activists alleged she was forced to hold Israeli flags, while NGOs cited systematic rights violations for detainees. Israel's embassy, however, denied all allegations, stating proper care was provided.

title: Post Asia Cup win: Suryakumar Yadav reveals biggest regret; involves MS Dhoni
content: India's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav expressed his regret at never playing under MS Dhoni's captaincy for the national team, though he admired his calm leadership. He described Virat Kohli as a hard taskmaster and Rohit Sharma as an inclusive leader.

title: 'Went to build better future': How 'robbery attempt' claimed Indian student's life in US
content: A 28-year-old Hyderabad student, Pole Chandrasekhar, was fatally shot in Texas, US, on October 3 during a suspected armed robbery at his part-time gas station job. Chandrasekhar, who was pursuing a master's, died on the spot. Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy expressed condolences and assured government support to repatriate his remains, with coordination underway with Indian officials.

title: West Bengal rains: 7 dead, several missing as landslides hit Darjeeling; iron bridge collapses
content: Kalimpong faced multiple landslides on Saturday after continuous heavy rainfall, disrupting traffic on NH10 and NH717A. Authorities confirmed no major damage or casualties, with teams actively clearing debris to restore connectivity. Heavy rain is predicted for West Bengal until October 6 due to a Bay of Bengal depression, urging vigilance.

title: US company lays off Indian workforce in 4 minutes: What happened; 8 coping tips
content: A US-based company recently laid off its Indian workforce in just four minutes during a virtual meeting, leaving employees shocked and unprepared. Beyond the financial impact, the emotional toll was severe. The focus is on the human side of sudden layoffs and eight practical coping strategies including financial planning, career rebuilding, and mental well-being to help professionals manage unexpected job loss.

title: Delhi court shocker: Man joins hearings in undergarments, smokes, drinks; arrested
content: Mohammad Imran, a 32-year-old history-sheeter with over 50 previous cases, was arrested for disrupting Tis Hazari Court virtual hearings. He appeared on screen in his undergarments, smoking and drinking, using fake identities. Police tracked him down after a complex investigation, revealing his drug and alcohol addiction led him to crime.

title: 'Rohit gave India 16 yrs, but we couldn't': Gill's role sparks questions
content: The BCCI announced Shubman Gill as the new ODI captain, concluding Rohit Sharma's successful leadership. Former cricketer Mohammad Kaif criticized this decision, highlighting Rohit's impressive record, including two recent ICC trophy wins, and questioning the premature transition. Rohit's future in ODI cricket and the 2027 World Cup now remain uncertain.

title: 'Cyclone Shakhti': IMD issues warning for Maha, Guj fishermen; heavy rain expected on Oct 8-9
content: Severe cyclonic storm Shakhti, formed off the Gujarat coast, moved westwards on Saturday, projected to curve east-northeastwards and weaken by October 6, 2025. Fishermen are advised against venturing into the northwest Arabian Sea. Concurrently, parts of Gujarat, including Dwarka and Ambaji, experienced rainfall, with Ahmedabad expecting light showers.

title: 'If you‚Äôre going to...' ‚Äì Ex-India coach‚Äôs remark on Rohit‚Äôs removal
content: Rohit Sharma has been replaced by Shubman Gill as India's ODI captain for the upcoming Australia series, sparking debate over Rohit's future and his 2027 World Cup participation. Former coach Abhishek Nayar stressed the importance of clear communication in this transition, supporting Gill's leadership while highlighting Rohit's prior 2027 aspirations.

title: Kerala: TN man slaps Israeli tourist in Varkala after mobile snatching incident; booked
content: Kerala Police registered a case against a Tamil Nadu native for assaulting an Israeli tourist in Varkala. The tourist allegedly snatched the man's mobile phone and threw it into the Arabian Sea, leading to the assault.

title: How much alcohol is safe to drink? Experts explain the permissible daily limit
content: Alcohol has long been a part of social and cultural life, but the question of how much is truly safe remains complex. Science shows that alcohol has a biphasic effect ‚Äî small amounts may offer some cardiovascular benefits, while higher intakes, even occasional, can harm the heart, liver, brain, and overall health. Individual factors like genetics, sex, and metabolism influence how the body processes alcohol, making ‚Äúsafe‚Äù levels vary from person to person.

title: Behaviour of Nitish Kumar at PM's function gives rise to suspicion about Bihar CM's 'mental health': Tejashwi Yadav
content: Tejashwi Yadav said, ‚ÄúClearly the CM no longer has the ability to run his government. A syndicate is calling the shots and it will be exposed soon‚Äù

title: Kerala government‚Äôs political motives evident in Mohanlal‚Äôs felicitation event, says AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal
content: The event to felicitate Mohanlal,  who won the Dadasaheb Phalke Award, was yet another strategy to divert attention from the Sabarimala controversies, says Venugopal

title: Vayalar Award for E. Santhosh Kumar
content: The award will be presented at a function to be held at the Nishagandhi auditorium on October 27, on Vayalar Ramavarma‚Äôs death anniversary

title: Sabarimala-centred controversies dog the Kerala government as the Legislative Assembly reconvenes on October 6
content: Congress leader Thiruvanchoor Radhakrishnan accuses the LDF government of illegally diverting the temple‚Äôs revenue from devotees to organise a ‚Äòpre-election political pageant with an eye on the votes of lakhs of Ayyappa devotees‚Äô

title: Seven car passengers injured in road accident at Ramanattukara
content: The accident took place at Ramanattukara on Sunday when they were coming back home after picking a family member from Kozhikode International Airport

title: Tamil Nadu‚Äôs achievement in total fertility rate of 1.4 is a significant milestone in population stabilisation: Geetha Jeevan
content: T.N. government is establishing a home in Chennai and Madurai in the name ‚ÄòAran‚Äô, which will serve as immediate shelter for transgenders who have left their homes, enabling them to continue their education and work

title: SIR purified voters‚Äô list in Bihar: CEC
content: ‚ÄúWe have an ERO (Electoral Registration Officer) in each of the 243 constituencies. They were assisted by 90,207 BLOs in completing the exercise, which has purified the voters‚Äô list after 22 years,‚Äù CEC Gyanesh Kumar said

title: Watch | Farewell: How the MiG-21 shaped the Indian Air Force
content: On September 26, 2025, the Indian Air Force bid an emotional farewell to the MiG-21 after six decades of service. We spoke to former MiG-21 pilots to understand why its legacy will never be forgotten.

title: Special squads formed to expose single digit lottery trade in Kozhikode
content: Action comes in the wake of confidential complaints submitted by the Lottery department furnishing the details of suspected tax evasion and financial loss

title: Woman killed, body cut and parts thrown at different places
content: The murder likely to have occurred a couple of days ago. Police are probing the case from all angles, said West Zone ACP N.S.V.K. Durga Rao

title: TDB questions Unnikrishnan Potti over misuse of Sabarimala artefacts for ‚Äòprivate worship‚Äô
content: Officials said the ongoing vigilance probe notably covered the recovery of two ‚Äúgold-plated coverings reported missing from Sabarimala‚Äù from the residence of Mr. Potti‚Äôs sister in Thiruvananthapuram last month

title: Leakages in Owk Reservoir will be plugged, says Minister Janardhan Reddy
content: Water is leaking from the reservoir from the minor breaches and a team of experts had already visited the reservoir, Minister explained

title: Jan Suraaj is cutting so much vote share of INDIA and NDA that they will be finished, says Prashant Kishor
content: ‚ÄúPersonally, I‚Äôm still on good terms with him, my fight with Nitish Kumar is not with him as an individual but with the government he heads,‚Äù Prashant Kishor said

title: Senior writer, folk scholar Mogalli Ganesh passes away at 64
content: He served as a Professor in the Department of Folklore Studies at Kannada University, Hampi, for nearly 28 years and was a Syndicate Member of Karnataka Folklore University, Shiggavi, in Haveri district

title: BPF's Hagrama Mohilary sworn in as chief of Bodoland Territorial Council in Assam
content: Former Minister Rihon Daimary was also sworn in as the deputy CEM at a function held at the Bodoland Secretariat Field, source said

title: Sonam Wangchuk¬†demands independent judicial inquiry into civilian deaths in Leh: lawyer
content: Sonam Wangchuk also appealed to people ‚Äúto keep peace and unity and continue with our struggle peacefully- in the true Gandhian way of non-violence‚Äù

title: India, EU to begin next round of talks for trade pact from Oct. 6 in Brussels
content: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has recently expressed hope that the two sides will sign the agreement soon

title: RAT gets deployed on Air India‚Äôs Birmingham-bound plane; aircraft lands safely
content: RAT deploys automatically in the eventuality of a dual engine failure or total electronic or hydraulic failure. It uses wind speed to generate emergency power

title: Mangalore University Physical Education Director passes away
content: Mangalore University‚Äôs Director of Physical Education C.K. Kishore Kumar, passes away at 60 in Mangaluru.

title: Playing for power in Haryana‚Äôs Ahirwal belt
content: The Ahirs, also known as the Yadavs and categorised as a backward class in Haryana, comprise just a little over 5% of the State‚Äôs electorate, but wield considerable power in the Gurugram-Rewari-Mahendragarh region. Two of the community‚Äôs leaders from the BJP, both from political families, struggle for dominance, while a third ‚Äì who is a self-made politician ‚Äì has sprung to prominence

title: Spelling errors on cheque leads to suspension of H.P. school teacher
content: The ‚Çπ7,616 cheque, issued on September 25, went viral on social media due to the striking spelling mistakes, reading "Saven Thursday Six Harendra Sixtey", drawing public ridicule

title: Tamil Nadu government to hold International Vallalar conference in Chennai: Sekar Babu
content: HR&CE Minister Sekar Babu said the Chief Minister had allocated ‚Çπ99.99 crore for establishment of the Vallalar International Centre in Vadalur

title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin inspects ongoing storm water drain work in Chennai
content: Mr. Stalin inspected the changing of drinking water pipes being undertaken by the Chennai Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board in areas in Alwarpet and areas on T.T.K. Road

title: Chennai Metro Rail‚Äôs TBMs to begin tunneling between Thiruvanmiyur and Indira Nagar for phase II project in November
content: Two tunnel boring machines (TBM) will create twin tunnels for a distance of nearly 650 metres between Thiruvanmiyur and Indira Nagar.

title: Bihar Assembly elections updates: If any political parties feel names have been left out, they can still apply, says CEC on SIR

title: 17 Dead In Darjeeling After Heavy Rain Triggers Landslides, Sikkim Cut Off
content: Seventeen people have died in West Bengal's Darjeeling after heavy rain triggered landslides and cut off road connectivity on key routes. Officials have said the calamity has cut off connectivity to the Himalayan state of Sikkim.

title: 3-Member Committee To Probe 18-Month-Old Baby's Death At Andhra Facility

title: 21-Year-Old Pregnant Woman Beaten To Death Over Dowry In Uttar Pradesh

title: Results and analysis from every fight
content: Alex Pereira  got his revenge against  Magomed Ankalaev , beating Ankalaev by first-round TKO to reclaim the UFC light heavyweight championship in the main event at UFC 320 in Las Vegas on Saturday night. Pereira immediately walked Ankalaev down, backing him up near the fence before dropping Ankalaev with a punch and finishing the fight with ground-and-pound on the mat. With the win, Pereira became the third fighter to win the light heavyweight title multiple times. Ankalaev had previously beat Pereira by unanimous decision at UFC 313 to win the belt earlier this year. In the co-main event,  Merab Dvalishvili  earned his  third UFC men's bantamweight title defense , beating  Cory Sandhagen  by unanimous decision. Dvalishvili dropped the first round to the challenger but found his rhythm in Round 2 and never looked back, scoring 20 takedowns and nearly knocking out Sandhagen en route to the victory. Brett Okamoto, Andreas Hale and Jeff Wagenheim break down all the action at UFC 320.

content: merab Dvalishvili won his third men's bantamweight title defense against Cory Sandhagen . the former light heavyweight champion has regained the throne again . pereira needed less than 90 seconds to overwhelm Magomed Ankalaev .
